short_summary: Three (3) Geomatics Analysts are required to work on site at the Hydrographic services office in Esquimalt BC.
description: The Department of National Defence Mapping and Charting Establishment (MCE) has a requirement for three (3) G.1 Geomatics Analysts Level 1 working on site at the Hydrographic Services Office in Esquimalt, BC to produce, validate and maintain Submarine Electronic Navigation Charts (SM ENC).",
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement for Geomatics Analysts
* **Title:** Three (3) Geomatics Analysts - Level 1
* **Reference Number:** W6369-24-X044
* **Publication Date:** 2024-06-27
* **Tender Closing Date ( Logistics urn Autumn Standard Time):** 2024-07-25 14:00:00
* **Solicitation Method:** Competitive - Selective Tendering
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
* **Trade Agreements:** WTO-GPA, CETA, CCFTA, CFTA, CPFTA, CColFTA, CPTPP, CHFTA, CPanFTA, CKFTA, CUFTA
* **Issuing Department:** Department of National Defence – Director Services Contracting 4

## Request Details

This Request for Proposal (RFP) requires qualified Geomatics Analysts, Level 1, to provide GIS services in the Pacific Region, specifically at the Hydrographic Services Office in Esquimalt, BC. The Department of National Defence Mapping and Charting Establishment (MCE) aims to produce, validate and maintain Submarine Electronic Navigation Charts (SEN Cs=jn hcenc a.o.)

## Deliverables and Work

* Deliverables: 3 Geomatics Analysts, Level 1
* Work duration: Estimated level of effort is 230 days per resource per year
* Contract duration: Approximately two (2) years from the contract start date, with an option to extend for up to three (3) additional one-year periods

## Security and Clearance

* Security Level: SRCL included with the RFP
* Minimum Corporate Security Required: Designated Organization Screening (DOS)
* Minimum Resource Security Required: Reliability Status

## Contact Information

Inquiries regarding this RFP should be submitted to the Contracting Authority:
* Name: Rob Best
* Email: [robert.best@forces.gc.ca](mailto:robert.best@forces.gc.ca)

## Submission Requirements

* Documents will be e-mailed directly to the qualified Supply Arrangement Holders invited to bid on this requirement.
* Bidders are advised that the Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

Please note that Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) Method of Supply is up-to-date weekly. If you wish to find out how to become a "Qualified SA Holder," please contact [RCNMDAI.-NCRIMOS@pwgsc.gc.ca
